title: How did humans first came up with the idea of time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Our own bodies have a time sense, because it is built into our heartbeat and our breathing. In fact, before clocks and watches were common, the body was used to measure time. It is said that Galileo discovered the law of pendulum movement by timing a swinging lantern by means of his pulse.

The apparent answer would be that humans may have first assigned a label to time, as in day and night, , but that the simplest algae observe it. The concept of time passing, or measuring time is, in our world a convention of language, perhaps taken to an abstract extreme by Einstein when he incorporated the concept of time into physical structure.
